page.title: 20TRENDS: WARLEY, ESSEX
page.content: The continuation of present trends in the area will depend upon how tightly the{Green Belt}policy is pursued. In 1985 one developer presented a proposal for a mini New Town in the Green Belt, only a few kilometres away from the block. This has been strongly resisted. To date the Green Belt has restricted the {growth of London}and also of towns within the Green Belt, such as Brentwood, pushing up{property prices within them. The current migration out of London to the{suburbs}has pushed up property prices even higher. The high cost of{commuting}seems not to act as a deterrent. Problems of{unemployment are relatively minor. The area seems to be amongst the most prosperous in Britain. Only radical change in government policy would be likely to change the situation.
